metadata.search_strategy: Comprehensive search of autism/ADHD datasets with multi-omics focus

spark.sample_size_notes: 100,000+ individuals with autism, largest genetic study
spark.access_instructions:
1. Create account at sparkforautism.org
2. Complete researcher registration
3. Submit Data Access Application describing research plan
4. Execute Data Use Agreement (DUA)
5. Approval timeline: 4-8 weeks
spark.citation: SPARK Consortium (2018). SPARK: A US Cohort of 50,000 Families to Accelerate Autism Research. Neuron, 97(3), 488-493.
spark.notes: Prioritized dataset - largest autism genetic cohort, ongoing recruitment

ssc.access_instructions:
1. Register at SFARI Base (base.sfari.org)
2. Complete online training module
3. Submit Data Access Request with research plan
4. Execute SFARI Base Data Use Certificate
5. Approval timeline: 2-4 weeks
ssc.download_method: SFARI Base portal, AWS S3 for genomics
ssc.citation: Fischbach, G. D., & Lord, C. (2010). The Simons Simplex Collection: a resource for identification of autism genetic risk factors. Neuron, 68(2), 192-195.
ssc.notes: High-quality phenotyping, simplex families ideal for de novo variant analysis

abcd.access_instructions:
1. Register at NDA (nda.nih.gov)
2. Complete NDA Data Access Request Tool
3. Provide institutional certification
4. Execute Data Use Certification (DUC)
5. Approval timeline: 2-6 weeks
abcd.download_method: NDA portal, downloadmanager CLI, AWS S3
abcd.citation: Volkow, N. D., et al. (2018). The conception of the ABCD study: From substance use to a broad NIH collaboration. Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience, 32, 4-7.
abcd.notes: Excellent for ADHD research, limited autism cases, rich neuroimaging and longitudinal data

ukb.access_instructions:
1. Register at ukbiobank.ac.uk/register-apply
2. Submit detailed research proposal (Material Transfer Agreement required)
3. Pay application fee (£2,500-6,000 depending on project scope)
4. Ethics approval from your institution
5. Approval timeline: 8-12 weeks
ukb.citation: Sudlow, C., et al. (2015). UK Biobank: An Open Access Resource for Identifying the Causes of a Wide Range of Complex Diseases of Middle and Old Age. PLoS Medicine, 12(3), e1001779.
ukb.notes: Excellent metabolomics (NMR, 249 biomarkers), but limited ADHD/autism cases, adult-only

ndar.access_instructions:
1. Create NDA account (ndar.nih.gov/user/create_account.html)
2. Complete Data Access Request Tool for each study
3. Provide institutional certification
4. Execute Data Use Certification
5. Approval timeline: 1-4 weeks (varies by study)
ndar.citation: Hall, D., Huerta, M. F., McAuliffe, M. J., & Farber, G. K. (2012). Sharing heterogeneous data: the national database for autism research. Neuroinformatics, 10(4), 331-339.
ndar.notes: Federated repository - aggregates many studies, variable data quality

agre.access_instructions:
1. Register at SFARI Base (base.sfari.org)
2. Complete AGRE access request
3. Execute Data Use Agreement
4. Approval timeline: 2-4 weeks
agre.citation: Geschwind, D. H., et al. (2001). The autism genetic resource exchange: a resource for the study of autism and related neuropsychiatric conditions. American Journal of Human Genetics, 69(2), 463-466.
agre.notes: Multiplex families ideal for linkage analysis, older dataset

dbgap_adhd_gwas.sample_size_notes: ~55,000 individuals across multiple ADHD GWAS studies
dbgap_adhd_gwas.access_instructions:
1. Register at dbGaP (www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap/)
2. Submit Data Access Request through dbGaP portal
3. Provide institutional certification and signing official
4. Execute Data Use Limitation terms
5. Approval timeline: 4-8 weeks
dbgap_adhd_gwas.citation: Demontis, D., et al. (2019). Discovery of the first genome-wide significant risk loci for attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder. Nature Genetics, 51(1), 63-75.
dbgap_adhd_gwas.notes: Multiple studies available: phs001224, phs000016, etc. Summary stats available without application
key_studies: phs000016.v2.p2 - Collaborative Genetic Study of ADHD

ega_autism.access_instructions:
1. Register at EGA (ega-archive.org/register)
2. Find relevant studies (search 'autism' or 'ADHD')
3. Submit Data Access Committee (DAC) application for each study
4. Provide institutional details and research plan
5. Approval timeline: 4-12 weeks (varies by DAC)
ega_autism.download_method: EGA Download Client (pyega3, EGA Java client)
ega_autism.citation: Lappalainen, I., et al. (2015). The European Genome-phenome Archive of human data consented for biomedical research. Nature Genetics, 47(7), 692-695.
ega_autism.notes: Federated repository, each study has own DAC and approval process

nhanes.dataset_name: NHANES (National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey)
nhanes.sample_size_notes: ~5,000 participants per cycle, limited ADHD data
nhanes.access_instructions:
1. Browse datasets at wwwn.cdc.gov/nchs/nhanes/
2. Download directly (no registration required for public data)
3. For restricted data: Submit RDC proposal to NCHS
4. Approval timeline: immediate (public) or 8-12 weeks (restricted)
nhanes.download_method: Direct download via web portal, R package 'nhanesA'
nhanes.citation: CDC. National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey Data. Hyattsville, MD: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
nhanes.notes: Limited metabolomics data, good for population controls, minimal autism/ADHD focus

phenomecentral.sample_size_notes: ~5,000 rare disease cases, subset with autism
phenomecentral.access_instructions:
1. Register at phenomecentral.org
2. Upload patient data or browse existing cases
3. Contact submitters for data sharing
4. Approval timeline: varies (case-by-case)
phenomecentral.citation: Buske, O. J., et al. (2015). PhenomeCentral: a portal for phenotypic and genotypic matchmaking of patients with rare genetic diseases. Human Mutation, 36(10), 931-940.
phenomecentral.notes: Focus on rare variants and syndrome-associated autism, matchmaking platform

geo_autism_expression.access_instructions:
1. Browse GEO database (www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/geo/)
2. Search for 'autism' or 'ADHD'
3. Download directly (no registration required)
4. For controlled access: Contact study authors
5. Approval timeline: immediate (public data)
geo_autism_expression.download_method: Direct FTP download, GEOquery R package, SRA toolkit
geo_autism_expression.citation: Barrett, T., et al. (2013). NCBI GEO: archive for functional genomics data sets—update. Nucleic Acids Research, 41(D1), D991-D995.
geo_autism_expression.notes: Heterogeneous studies, good for meta-analysis, mostly tissue-based expression
key_studies: GSE111176 - iPSC-derived neurons from ASD patients

metabolights.access_instructions:
1. Browse MetaboLights (www.ebi.ac.uk/metabolights/)
2. Search for 'autism' or 'ADHD'
3. Download directly (no registration required for public data)
4. Approval timeline: immediate
metabolights.citation: Haug, K., et al. (2020). MetaboLights: a resource evolving in response to the needs of its scientific community. Nucleic Acids Research, 48(D1), D440-D444.
metabolights.notes: Limited autism/ADHD studies, good for pilot metabolomics analysis

metabolomics_workbench.access_instructions:
1. Browse at metabolomicsworkbench.org
2. Search for 'autism' or 'ADHD'
3. Download directly (no registration required)
4. Approval timeline: immediate
metabolomics_workbench.citation: Sud, M., et al. (2016). Metabolomics Workbench: An international repository for metabolomics data and metadata, metabolite standards, protocols, tutorials and training, and analysis tools. Nucleic Acids Research, 44(D1), D463-D470.
metabolomics_workbench.notes: NIH-funded repository, limited autism/ADHD content but growing

gwas_catalog.sample_size_notes: Summary statistics from studies with 100,000+ participants
gwas_catalog.access_instructions:
1. Browse GWAS Catalog (www.ebi.ac.uk/gwas/)
2. Search for trait: 'ADHD' or 'autism'
3. Download summary statistics directly
4. For full data: Follow links to original studies
5. Approval timeline: immediate (summary stats)
gwas_catalog.citation: Sollis, E., et al. (2023). The NHGRI-EBI GWAS Catalog: knowledgebase and deposition resource. Nucleic Acids Research, 51(D1), D977-D985.
gwas_catalog.notes: Excellent for genetic risk loci, no individual-level data, summary stats only

openeuro.access_instructions:
1. Browse OpenNeuro (openneuro.org)
2. Search for 'autism' or 'ADHD'
3. Download directly (no registration required)
4. Approval timeline: immediate
openeuro.citation: Markiewicz, C. J., et al. (2021). The OpenNeuro resource for sharing of neuroscience data. eLife, 10, e71774.
openeuro.notes: BIDS format, excellent for neuroimaging analysis, limited multi-omics
key_datasets: ds000228 - ABIDE (Autism Brain Imaging Data Exchange)

loni_ida.access_instructions:
1. Register at ida.loni.usc.edu
2. Request access to specific collections
3. Execute Data Use Agreement for each study
4. Approval timeline: 2-6 weeks (varies by study)
loni_ida.citation: Crawford, K. L., et al. (2016). LONI Image & Data Archive: A Federating Repository of Neuroimaging Data. NeuroImage, 124, 1080-1083.
loni_ida.notes: Focus on neuroimaging, limited omics data

simons_searchlight.access_instructions:
1. Register at SFARI Base (base.sfari.org)
2. Submit Data Access Request
3. Execute Data Use Certificate
4. Approval timeline: 2-4 weeks
simons_searchlight.citation: Simons Searchlight Consortium. Simons Searchlight: A resource for the autism research community. www.simonssearchlight.org
simons_searchlight.notes: Focus on rare high-impact variants (CHD8, SCN2A, etc.), deep phenotyping

mssng.access_instructions:
1. Register at mss.ng
2. Submit Data Access Application
3. Execute Data Use Agreement
4. Approval via Google Cloud Platform access
5. Approval timeline: 4-8 weeks
mssng.citation: Yuen, R. K., et al. (2017). Whole genome sequencing resource identifies 18 new candidate genes for autism spectrum disorder. Nature Neuroscience, 20(4), 602-611.
mssng.notes: Largest autism WGS dataset, cloud-based access, requires GCP credits
mssng.cost: free (data access), GCP compute costs apply

abide.access_instructions:
1. Visit fcon_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/abide/
2. Download directly (no registration required)
3. Available via AWS S3, NITRC, LORIS
4. Approval timeline: immediate
abide.download_method: Direct download, AWS S3, wget scripts provided
abide.citation: Di Martino, A., et al. (2017). Enhancing studies of the connectome in autism using the autism brain imaging data exchange II. Scientific Data, 4, 170010.
abide.notes: Gold standard autism neuroimaging dataset, preprocessed versions available
abide.update_frequency: static (ABIDE I complete, ABIDE II complete)

adhd200.access_instructions:
1. Visit fcon_1000.projects.nitrc.org/indi/adhd200/
2. Download directly (no registration required)
3. Approval timeline: immediate
adhd200.citation: ADHD-200 Consortium. (2012). The ADHD-200 Consortium: A Model to Advance the Translational Potential of Neuroimaging in Clinical Neuroscience. Frontiers in Systems Neuroscience, 6, 62.
adhd200.notes: Standard ADHD neuroimaging dataset, includes medication status

imagen.access_instructions:
1. Submit proposal via imagen-europe.com/contact
2. Describe research objectives and analysis plan
3. Execute Data Sharing Agreement
4. Approval by IMAGEN steering committee
5. Approval timeline: 8-12 weeks
imagen.citation: Schumann, G., et al. (2010). The IMAGEN study: reinforcement-related behaviour in normal brain function and psychopathology. Molecular Psychiatry, 15(12), 1128-1139.
imagen.notes: Excellent longitudinal adolescent dataset, limited autism focus

enigma_adhd.access_instructions:
1. Join ENIGMA consortium (enigma.ini.usc.edu/join-enigma/)
2. Participate in working group
3. Contribute data or analyze shared summary statistics
4. Approval timeline: varies (collaboration-based)
enigma_adhd.citation: Hoogman, M., et al. (2017). Subcortical brain volume differences in participants with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder in children and adults: a cross-sectional mega-analysis. The Lancet Psychiatry, 4(4), 310-319.
enigma_adhd.notes: Meta-analysis framework, not individual-level data, requires contribution

enigma_autism.access_instructions:
1. Join ENIGMA consortium (enigma.ini.usc.edu/join-enigma/)
2. Participate in working group
3. Contribute data or analyze shared summary statistics
4. Approval timeline: varies (collaboration-based)
enigma_autism.citation: van Rooij, D., et al. (2018). Cortical and subcortical brain morphometry differences between patients with autism spectrum disorder and healthy individuals across the lifespan: results from the ENIGMA ASD Working Group. American Journal of Psychiatry, 175(4), 359-369.
enigma_autism.notes: Meta-analysis framework, not individual-level data, requires contribution

psych_encode.access_instructions:
1. Browse psychencode.org
2. Most data available via direct download
3. For controlled access data: Apply via dbGaP (phs001629)
4. Approval timeline: immediate (open) or 4-8 weeks (controlled)
psych_encode.download_method: Direct download, dbGaP for controlled access
psych_encode.citation: Wang, D., et al. (2018). Comprehensive functional genomic resource and integrative model for the human brain. Science, 362(6420), eaat8464.
psych_encode.notes: Excellent for brain expression and epigenomics, limited clinical phenotypes

brain_cloud.access_instructions:
1. Visit braincloud.jhmi.edu
2. Download directly (no registration required)
3. Approval timeline: immediate
brain_cloud.citation: Colantuoni, C., et al. (2011). Temporal dynamics and genetic control of transcription in the human prefrontal cortex. Nature, 478(7370), 519-523.
brain_cloud.notes: Developmental trajectory focus, no autism-specific diagnoses but useful for reference

brain_span.access_instructions:
1. Visit brainspan.org
2. Browse and download directly
3. Approval timeline: immediate
brain_span.citation: Miller, J. A., et al. (2014). Transcriptional landscape of the prenatal human brain. Nature, 508(7495), 199-206.
brain_span.notes: Excellent developmental reference, no disease samples

gtex.access_instructions:
1. Visit gtexportal.org
2. Browse and download summary data directly
3. For protected data: Apply via dbGaP (phs000424)
4. Approval timeline: immediate (open) or 4-8 weeks (protected)
gtex.download_method: Direct download, dbGaP for full data, BigQuery
gtex.citation: GTEx Consortium. (2020). The GTEx Consortium atlas of genetic regulatory effects across human tissues. Science, 369(6509), 1318-1330.
gtex.notes: Excellent reference for tissue expression and eQTLs, no disease phenotypes

sfari_gene.sample_size_notes: Not a sample repository - curated gene database
sfari_gene.access_instructions:
1. Visit gene.sfari.org
2. Browse or search directly
3. Download gene lists
4. Approval timeline: immediate
sfari_gene.citation: Abrahams, B. S., et al. (2013). SFARI Gene 2.0: a community-driven knowledgebase for the autism spectrum disorders (ASDs). Molecular Autism, 4(1), 36.
sfari_gene.notes: Curated autism gene database, not sample data, excellent for prioritization
